description: Starts a Device Defender ML Detect mitigation actions task. Requires permission to access the StartDetectMitigationActionsTask action.

parameters.name: taskId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the task.

parameters.name: target
parameters.description: Specifies the ML Detect findings to which the mitigation actions are applied. violationIds (list) --- The unique identifiers of the violations. (string) --- securityProfileName (string) --- The name of the security profile. behaviorName (string) --- The name of the behavior.

nested_params.name: violationIds
nested_params.description: The unique identifiers of the violations.

nested_params.name: securityProfileName
nested_params.description: The name of the security profile.

parameters.name: actions
parameters.description: The actions to be performed when a device has unexpected behavior. (string) ---

parameters.name: violationEventOccurrenceRange
parameters.description: Specifies the time period of which violation events occurred between. The start date and time of a time period in which violation events occurred. The end date and time of a time period in which violation events occurred.

nested_params.name: startTime
nested_params.description: The start date and time of a time period in which violation events occurred.

nested_params.name: endTime
nested_params.description: The end date and time of a time period in which violation events occurred.

parameters.name: clientRequestToken
parameters.description: Each mitigation action task must have a unique client request token. If you try to create a new task with the same token as a task that already exists, an exception occurs. If you omit this value, Amazon Web Services SDKs will automatically generate a unique client request. This field is autopopulated if not provided.

nested_items.name: taskId
nested_items.description: The unique identifier of the task.
